description: Knights-move Pascal triangle: T(n,k), n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n; T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1, T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + T(n-2,k-1) for k = 1,2,...,n-1, n >= 2.
comments: Also square array T(n,k) (n >= 0, k >= 0) read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..k} C(n,i).As a number triangle read by rows, this is T(n,k) = sum{i=n-2*k..n-k, binomial(n-k,i)}, with T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + T(n-2,k-1). Row sums are A000071(n+2). Diagonal sums are A023435(n+1). It is the reverse of the Whitney triangle A004070. - _Paul Barry_, Sep 04 2005
